info.headline: Excessive Heat Warning issued July 11 at 11:54AM PDT until July 17 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM FRIDAY TO 5 PM PDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Life-threatening daytime heat and overnight temperatures struggling to fall below 100. This will result in a extreme risk of heat related illness for anyone exposed to the heat for a prolonged period. * WHERE...Death Valley National Park. * WHEN...From 11 AM Friday to 5 PM Monday. * IMPACTS...Several days of extreme heat will result in a major concern for life-threatening heat illnesses for anyone outside for an extended period. Anyone without access to adequate indoor cooling will be especially vulnerable as overnight temperatures will provide very little, if any, overnight relief from the heat. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...With high temperatures well over 120 degrees in the daytime and barely falling below 100 at night, anyone exposed to the outdoors in Death Valley will be facing an extreme risk of heat related illness, especially anyone recreating. Temperatures are expected to be well over 100 degrees even in shaded areas like slot canyons. Any prolonged exposure to the heat is highly discouraged. Anyone who may encounter car trouble could be facing a life threatening situation, especially where phone signal prohibits calling for help.
info.instruction: Take an extreme level of precautions if you work or plan on venturing outside. When possible, reschedule strenuous activities to other days. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location immediately. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.
